dialogueTreeDescription: The player wakes up on the prison boat and speaks to Juib for the first time.

dialogueNodes.text: Jiub: Stand up. There you go. You were dreaming. What's your name?

responses.text: My name is Sadrayn. And you are...?
I'm not telling you anything. I'm not sure I trust you.
Why, I'm Lord Nerevar, of course! Don't you recognize me?

dialogueNodes.description: Jiub greets the player when they wake up on the boat.

dialogueNodes.text: Jiub: Well, not even last night's storm could wake you. I heard them say we've reached Morrowind, I'm sure they'll let us go.

responses.text: Morrowind? I see. But why here, of all places?
Don't be so sure. If they can lock us up without a fair trial I see no reason for them to go easy on us.

dialogueNodes.description: Jiub tells the player they slept heavily last night, and that they've reached Morrowind.

dialogueNodes.text: Hit your head on the way over here, hmm? Very well, Lord Nerevar, you'll be pleased to know we've reached Morrowind. Welcome home...s'wit.

responses.text: Watch your language, peasant, or I'll have you in jail!
Just kidding. I'm Sadrayn. And you are?
Hey, no need for that attitude. Jeez, you really have no sense of humor, do you?

dialogueNodes.description: The player has just told Jiub that they are Lord Nerevar, and he's not amused.
